revised_title: Toxic Fish in the South Seas: A Study of Symptoms and Treatment
tldr: In a letter to Sir John Pringle, William Anderson describes the effects of eating poisonous fish in the South Seas on his ship's crew. The symptoms included nausea, vomiting, weakness, and severe pain in the limbs. Anderson also discusses the possible causes of the poisoning and the limited treatment options available at the time. The fish species involved, Sparus Pagrus, was identified as the likely culprit, though its toxicity may not be consistent across all specimens.
